result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J. Matthew was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in full with cash bond. Refunding unused balance to poster.

Jail sentence may be served in an in-patient rehabilitation center, day-for-day. 
** Amended 8/9/16 to include: Jail time has limited Huber privileges granted, exercisable only within the Jail. **
Consecutive to: to sentence now serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Elements

Defendant sentenced to 5 months County jail, consecutive to sentence now serving. 
19 days credit. 
Jail sentence may be served in an in-patient rehabilitation center, day-for-day. 
Defendant ordered to pay costs of the action.
